{"step_by_step_thinking": "The umbilical cord is the lifeline between the mother and the developing fetus. It contains blood vessels that transport oxygen and nutrients from the mother to the fetus and remove waste products from the fetus. The umbilical cord typically contains one vein and two arteries. The vein carries oxygenated blood from the placenta to the fetus, while the arteries carry deoxygenated blood and waste products from the fetus back to the placenta. Therefore, the correct answer is D. 2 arteries & 1 vein.", "answer_choice": "D"}
